text:
[canonfire] [seagulls]
♫ [knockoff "Pirates of the Caribbean" theme]
Hey guys, it's Ro! Welcome to another Nerdy Nummies!
I got so many requests to make something pirate-themed so that is exactly what we're going to be doing today.
I personally love Pirates of the Caribbean,
one of my favorite pirate stories.
And, I even dressed up!
I also got a lot of requests from you guys to make a savory dish.
And, for a new pie recipe.
And I thought, let's put all of these things together.
Today, let's make a Pirate Chicken Pot Pie.
Do you get it? A "Pie"rate Pot Pie.
Let's get started!
We are going to be making a fresh chicken pot pie from scratch,
so there is a lot of ingredients.
The things you will need to make our crust will be:
2½ cups of all purpose flour,
6 tablespoons of buttermilk,
½ cup of butter-flavored Crisco,
½ cup of salted butter,
2 teaspoons of sugar,
and 1 teaspoon of salt.
And then, for our pot pie filling:
1 stick of butter,
1 cup of milk,
1 cup of chicken stock,
1 onion―I'm only going to be using half,
4 stalks of celery
4 carrots,
2 chicken breasts,
1 cup of corn,
½ cup of peas,
1 teaspoon of salt,
2 tablespoons of oil,
and 4 ounces of all-purpose flour.
Now let's put it all together!
We're going to start by making our pie dough.
The first thing that I'm going to do is
add my flour
sugar
and salt
to a food processor
and mix them together until they're well combined.
Once mixed together, we're going to add
our butter

Eeh!
[clink]
and the BOWL
and our shortening.
ALMOST THERE!
Then we're going to mix it up
by pulsing it until it becomes crumbly,
and you don't see any more of the butter or shortening.
Now, WHILE pulsing, we're gonna slowly add our buttermilk.
Our dough is ready, and now, we are gonna let it chill
while we make our filling. But before I do that,
I'm gonna scoop it onto some plastic wrap,
and wrap it up tight.
Then place it in the fridge to chill.
To make our filling, the first thing that we're gonna do is
chop up our fresh vegetables, starting with our onion!
Cut off the top of the onion, and the bottom.
Cut it in half, 'cause we only need half a onion.
Peel off the skin, cut doot-doot-doot into little pieces.
Now for our celery. Cut it once, straight down the middle.
Turn it to the side.
Chop! (x9)
Chop.
Chop.
Now, peel and chop all of our carrots.
On a clean surface, chop our chicken into little chunks.
Take all of our filling ingredients over to the stove.
Heat a large pan over medium heat.
Add the oil, and let the pan get hot.
Add the chicken, and stir until the chicken turns white all over.
Add those chopped carrots, celery, onions, and salt.
Stir it up, and cook for about five minutes.
Then stir in the corn, and peas.
Once stirred in, turn off the heat, and set your mixture off to the side.
Now, place a smaller pan on the stove.
Turn the heat to medium, and allow all of the butter to melt.
Add the flour and mix completely to make a paste.
And cook for one minute.
This mixture is called a roux!
Then, simultaneously pour the chicken stock into the pan
while whisking, and mix until combined.
Then, do the same thing with the milk.
Pour it in WHILE whisking, and mix until the mixture thickens.
Everything is hot off the stove,
and now I'm gonna pour my sauce into the chicken and vegetables.
This sauce is called a Béchamel! [giggles]
It is delicious!
♪ Yo-ho-hi-ho! A pirate pot-pie for me! ♪
Once we're done mixing it up,
it's really hot, so I'm gonna set it off to the side
just to cool down for a little bit.
And while it's cooling, we're gonna roll out our pie dough.
So you guys know what that means.
We're gonna try to do a little bakin' flair now!
Here we go! [fwoosh]
[clunk]
[someone off-camera]: "Okay."
Okay, we're done now.
Take a little pinch of flour, sprinkle it all over,
so that your dough doesn't stick.
Roll it out to be about a quarter-inch thick.
My dough is rolled out, and now it's ready to
transfer on top of my pot pie.
What I like to do is gently roll the dough onto
the rolling pin, just like this.
And gently pick it up, and transfer it over the top.
Just using my thumb, I'm gonna go around the edges,
letting the excess dough fall off.
And with the excess dough, we're gonna make some decorations!
To decorate our "Pie"rate pie, I'm gonna be cutting out
a skull and crossbones for decorations!
Starting with the skull. I got this little cookie cutter online.
Give it a little jiggle. I'm also gonna cut out four bones.
This is a little doggie bone cookie cutter that I had lying around.
Then you can remove the excess dough. And eat it all! He-he-heh!
Using a small sharp cutting knife, I'm just gonna be cutting off one end.
I've got this little jagged edge cookie cutter.
Press it down, cut 'em off to separate.
Wreh-reh-reh-reh-reh!
A small triangle for the nose, and a larger curved triangle  for the eyes.
Our decorations are ready, and over here, I've got a little bit of egg wash.
It's just one egg and a little bit of salt.
And a little baking brush. Put a little bit on the top of our pie to attach our decorations.
Then, using a spatula, pick up our decorations and place them onto the top of the pie.
Press 'em down a little bit, now with his mouth, leave a little space.
'Cause my skull, he's laughing, he's like "Hurh-ruh-ruhh!
[laughs]
Last but not least, place our little crossbones.
They don't look like doggie bones anymore!
Cut some slits along the top for ventilation.
Because the inside is gonna create a lot of steam.
And we need some ventilation to let that steam out!
Final step before we bake,
egg wash the entire top of the pie.
This is gonna make it look shiny, and turn a golden brown.
I've place the pie on top of a baking tray,
because sometimes when it bakes, it will bubble.
And that's okay, 'cause we've got a tray, to catch it.
Now I'm gonna heat my oven to 375 degrees
and bake for about 40 to 45 minutes.
Ta~DAAAA! Here is the "Pie"rate pot pie that we made today!
A big thank you to you guys, for suggesting something pirate-themed!
I'll be posting this recipe and a bunch of pictures on RosannaPansino.com, Instagram, Facebook, and Twitter.
You can check 'em out there, and, if you guys make this pie,
please take a picture and send it to me.
I love seeing your baking creations.
It just makes me happy, it makes my day.
Especially when, it's a savory dish! We don't make these very often.
So this was really fun!
And, if you have any other ideas, for any other Nerdy Nummies,
please let me know, and leave me a comment down below, and I will do my best to make it happen.
Alright, thanks again you guys! Buh-bye!
Arrr! You guys, what do you call a pirate who skipped school?
Captain Hooky!
[giggles] Do you get it? 'Cause it's the-
Alright, now I'm gonna have a piece of pie for me!
♪ M-m-m-mm, a piece of pie for me! ♪
This is two thumbs up, and a peg leg!
[thump] [CLANG]
Oop!
♪[Nerdy Nummies theme]♪
